intro: Cyrtococcum, commonly known as the velvetleaf or velvetleaf fern, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Araceae. It is characterized by its heart-shaped leaves and striking, spadix-like inflorescence. The plant is native to tropical and subtropical regions of the Americas. Cyrtococcum species often thrive in moist, shaded environments, making them common in humid forests. Their botanical features make them popular in ornamental horticulture due to their unique foliage and floral structures.
